body.name: Black Eyed Saint: Warhammer Horror
body.description: Book Three in the Tales of Mhurghast SeriesA young girl begs the aid of the faithful to rescue a city beleaguered by a sinister malaise.Listen to it becauseIt's a fascinating glimpse into the bizarre and deadly situations that plague the citizens of the Mortal Realms, as dark magic and twisted schemes lurk around every corner.The storyA girl stumbles across the moors, death hard on her heels. To her saviours, she speaks of Calignius – a smog-shrouded mining town deep in the mountains that has been gripped by a strange epidemic.Now, Runar Skoldolfr and Tiberius Grim must lead a small expedition into the haunted vales of the Blood-Rock Peaks to answer the girl’s pleas for aid. There, the hunter and the veteran priest of Sigmar will uncover the enigma of a forlorn-looking statue and its curious sway over the town – a place ruled by ancient fear and phobia, zealotry and madness.Separated and isolated, Runar and Tiberius will learn there are far worse fates than death, for in Calignius friendships turn sour, faith boils into anguish, and long-buried nightmares rise up from the shadows. If they are to survive, they will need to find a way to unite against the daemons that divide them. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really a nice surprise!
reviews.reviewText: I’m a sucker for all the Warhammer horror novels. This one was an excellent entry into the series and I highly recommend it. It starts off with a great mystery, builds into great supernatural horror, and ends in an excellent Warhammer/medieval fantasy battle! I don’t wanna spoil anything, so I’ll just leave it at that. Definitely worth a purchase, and the audio version is excellent!
Bit of a slow boiler but well written and a good entry in the tales.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am enjoying reading these novels. The horror aspect interests me more than the warfare side of things as that more intimate confrontation with evil forces is alignment with the role playing side of the game.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Of all the Warhammer horror novels I've read this has to be one of the best.The "twist" ending wasn't really a twist but it allows the option of spinoff series.
